title: NIFI-5090: Create move target dir dynamically at FetchFTP and FetchSFTP
body:
## NOTES

This PR contains two commits. The first one 3dc909d is mandatory.

The 2nd one 8ec8a25 improves 'disable directory listing' scenario. Before this commit, if directory listing was disabled and parent directory was not found, FetchSFTP did not try creating the missing parent directories. The 2nd commit made the processor to create parent directories. It affects to PutSFTP, too.

I didn't create another JIRA for the 2nd commit, since these can be tested and reviewed easier at the same time. Please let me know if you, reviewer think it should be managed separately.

I used following docker images for testing:
- atmoz/sftp
- stilliard/pure-ftpd:hardened

A NiFi flow template is also available here:
https://gist.github.com/ijokarumawak/4fb05da103fd10f3ae6038f3388eb062

Thanks!

title: NIFI-5070 Fix java.sql.SQLException: ERROR 1101 (XCL01): ResultSet is…
body:
… closed

Discovered on Phoenix Database by using QueryDatabaseTable processor. The fix consists
on applying Matt Burgess' suggestion:

"I think we'd need a try/catch around the next() only to see if the result set is closed,
and an inner try/catch around everything else, to catch other errors not related to
this behavior. "

The solution was verified against Phoenix DB. Also added unit tests to cover the
change.

title: NIFI-5049 Fix handling of Phonenix datetime columns
body:
Fixed Error: ERROR 203 (22005): Type mismatch. TIMESTAMP
and VARCHAR for <COLUMN_NAME> = '2015-09-12 18:19:43.293'
(sample date).

The fix consists on applying the same fix added to Oracle DB,
based on NIFI-2323 approach. The changes introduced were:

1) A Phoenix database adapter.
2) Handling timestamp, date and time in Phoenix.
3) Added a close to result set in QueryDatabaseTable processor
   (not related to this bug, but I think it will be useful to
    fix).

The changes don't break existing code.

title: NIFI-5037 - ConsumeEWS Fails to Read Emtpy Message Body Emails
body:
When an email has no message body, ConsumeEWS fails to read the message.
There is nothing wrong with having no message body, but _setting_ an empty message body in Apache Email Commons is not allowed. Added step to not set the message body if empty. In testing this resolved the issue.

title: NIFI-3576 Support for QueryInfo relationship, useful for nohit queries
body:
This pr adds a new relationship, and a property/strategy for when it is used.
The new relationship has an empty flow file with attributes about the query, right now the query string and the number of hits.

The relationship is dynamically made available based on the strategy selected:

Never : um, never send query information
Always: always send it
NoHit: Send it when there are no hits.
